name: Particle
comment:
Particle is a subclass of [`Pt`](#link) that has radius and mass. It's usually added into [`World`](#link) to create physics simulations.
See [a demo here](../demo/index.html?name=physics.particles).

signatures.comment: Create a particle. Once a particle is created, you can set its mass and radius via the corresponding accessors.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: a list of numeric parameters, an array of numbers, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

accessors.name: body
accessors.comment: Get the body of this particle, if any.

accessors.name: changed
accessors.comment: Get the change in position since last time step.

accessors.name: lock
accessors.comment: Lock this particle in current position.

accessors.name: position
accessors.comment: Set a new position, and update previous and lock states if needed.

accessors.name: w
accessors.comment: Value in the forth dimension of this Pt

accessors.name: x
accessors.comment: Value in the first dimensional of this Pt

accessors.name: y
accessors.comment: Value in the second dimension of this Pt

accessors.name: z
accessors.comment: Value in the third dimension of this Pt

signatures.comment: Get a new Pt with absolute values of this Pt.
Like [`Pt.add`](#link), but returns result as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a new Pt with ceiling values of this Pt.
Concatenate this Pt with addition dimensional values and return as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt,  or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: 3D Cross product of this Pt and another Pt. Return results as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: 2D Cross product of this Pt and another Pt. Return results as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Like [`Pt.divide`](#link), but returns result as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a new Pt with floor values of this Pt.
Get a new Pt that has the maximum dimensional values of this Pt and another Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a new Pt that has the minimum dimensional values of this Pt and another Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Like [`Pt.multiply`](#link), but returns result as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Calculate vector projection of this Pt on another Pt.
signatures.returns_comment: the projection vector as a Pt

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a new Pt with rounded values of this Pt.
Like [`Pt.subtract`](#link), but returns result as a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Take specific dimensional values from this Pt and create a new Pt.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: a string such as "xy" (use Const.xy) or an array to specify indices

signatures.comment: Like [`Pt.to`](#link) but returns a new Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a new unit vector from this Pt.
Absolute values for all values in this pt.
Add scalar or vector values to this Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Add to the accumulated force.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: a list of numeric parameters, an array of numbers, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get angle of this Pt from origin.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: a string such as "xy" (use Const.xy) or an array to specify index for two dimensions

signatures.comment: Get the angle between this and another Pt.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: the other Pt

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: a string such as "xy" (use Const.xy) or an array to specify index for two dimensions

signatures.comment: Ceiling values for all values in this Pt.
Clone this Pt and return it as a new Pt.
Check and respoond to collisions between this and another particle.

parameters.name: p2
parameters.comment: another particle

parameters.name: damp
parameters.comment: damping value between 0 to 1, where 1 means no damping.

signatures.comment:
Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end
to the same array starting at position target

parameters.name: target
parameters.comment:
If target is negative, it is treated as length+target where length is the
length of the array.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment:
If start is negative, it is treated as length+start. If end is negative, it
is treated as length+end.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment: If not specified, length of the this object is used as its default value.

signatures.comment: Divide this Pt over scalar or vector values (as element-wise).

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Dot product of this Pt and another Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Returns an array of key, value pairs for every entry in the array
Check if another Pt is equal to this Pt, within a threshold.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: another Pt to compare with

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.comment: a threshold value within which the two Pts are considered equal. Default is 0.000001.

signatures.comment: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The every method calls
the callbackfn function for each element in array1 until the callbackfn returns false,
or until the end of the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Returns the this object after filling the section identified by start and end with value

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment: value to fill array section with

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment:
index to start filling the array at. If start is negative, it is treated as
length+start where length is the length of the array.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment:
index to stop filling the array at. If end is negative, it is treated as
length+end.

signatures.comment: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The filter method calls
the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, find
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, find returns undefined.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

signatures.comment:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findIndex returns -1.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

signatures.comment: Floor values for all values in this Pt.
Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. forEach calls the
callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Hit this particle with an impulse.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: an impulse vector defined by either a list of numeric parameters, an array of numbers, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array.

parameters.name: searchElement
parameters.comment: The value to locate in the array.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.comment:
The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the
 search starts at index 0.

signatures.comment: Adds all the elements of an array separated by the specified separator string.

parameters.name: separator
parameters.comment:
A string used to separate one element of an array from the next in the
resulting String. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

signatures.comment: Returns an list of keys in the array
Returns the index of the last occurrence of a value in an array.

parameters.name: searchElement
parameters.comment: The value to locate in the array.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.comment:
The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the
search starts at index 0.

signatures.comment: Get the distance (magnitude) of this Pt from origin.
Get the squared distance (magnitude) of this Pt from origin.

Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that
contains the results.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The map method calls the
callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Find the maximum value across all dimensions in this Pt.
signatures.returns_comment: an object with `value` and `index` which returns the maximum value and its dimensional index

signatures.comment: Find the minimum value across all dimensions in this Pt.
signatures.returns_comment: an object with `value` and `index` which returns the minimum value and its dimensional index

signatures.comment: Multiply scalar or vector values (as element-wise) with this Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Create an operation using this Pt, passing this Pt into a custom function's first parameter. See the [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.
signatures.returns_comment: a resulting function that takes other parameters required in `fn`

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: any function that takes a Pt as its first parameter

tags.text: `let myOp = pt.op( fn ); let result = myOp( [1,2,3] );`

signatures.comment: This combines a series of operations into an array. See the [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.

parameters.name: fns
parameters.comment: an array of functions for `op`

tags.text: `let myOps = pt.ops([fn1, fn2, fn3]); let results = myOps.map( (op) => op([1,2,3]) );`

signatures.comment: Calculate scalar projection.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment:
Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of
the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next
call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the
callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

signatures.comment:
Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of
the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next
call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the
callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.comment:
If initialValue is specified, it is used as the initial value to start
the accumulation. The first call to the callbackfn function provides this value as an argument
instead of an array value.

signatures.comment:
Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order.
The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an
argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduceRight method calls
the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

signatures.comment:
Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order.
The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an
argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduceRight method calls
the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.comment:
If initialValue is specified, it is used as the initial value to start
the accumulation. The first call to the callbackfn function provides this value as an argument
instead of an array value.

signatures.comment: Reflect this Pt along a 2D line.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts that defines a line for reflection

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional axis such as "yz" to define a 2D plane of reflection

signatures.comment: Reverses the elements in an Array.
Rotate this Pt from origin or from an anchor point in 2D.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.comment: rotate angle

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional string such as "yz" to specify a 2D plane

signatures.comment: Rounded values for all values in this Pt.
Scale this Pt from origin or from an anchor point.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.comment: scale ratio

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

signatures.comment: Sets a value or an array of values.

parameters.name: array
parameters.comment: A typed or untyped array of values to set.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.comment: The index in the current array at which the values are to be written.

signatures.comment: Shear this Pt from origin or from an anchor point in 2D.

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional string such as "yz" to specify a 2D plane

signatures.comment: Set the size of this particle. This sets both the radius and the mass.

parameters.name: r
parameters.comment: `radius` value, and also set `mass` to the same value.

signatures.comment: Returns a section of an array.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment: The beginning of the specified portion of the array.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment: The end of the specified portion of the array.

signatures.comment: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The some method calls the
callbackfn function for each element in array1 until the callbackfn returns true, or until
the end of the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Sorts an array.

parameters.name: compareFn
parameters.comment:
The name of the function used to determine the order of the elements. If
omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, ASCII character order.

signatures.comment:
Gets a new Float32Array view of the ArrayBuffer store for this array, referencing the elements
at begin, inclusive, up to end, exclusive.

parameters.name: begin
parameters.comment: The index of the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment: The index of the end of the array.

signatures.comment: Subtract scalar or vector values from this Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Update the values of this Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Update the values of this Pt to point at a specific angle.

parameters.name: radian
parameters.comment: target angle in radian

parameters.name: magnitude
parameters.comment: Optional magnitude if known. If not provided, it'll calculate and use this Pt's magnitude.

parameters.name: anchorFromPt
parameters.comment: If `true`, translate to new position from current position. Default is `false` which update the position from origin (0,0);

signatures.comment: Convert this Pt to a javascript Array.
Converts a number to a string by using the current locale.
Get a string representation of this particle
Convert to a unit vector, which is a normalized vector whose magnitude equals to 1.

parameters.name: magnitude
parameters.comment: Optional: if the magnitude is known, pass it as a parameter to avoid duplicate calculation.

signatures.comment: Returns an list of values in the array
Verlet integration.

parameters.name: dt
parameters.comment: change in time

parameters.name: friction
parameters.comment: friction from 0 to 1, where 1 means no friction

parameters.name: lastDt
parameters.comment: optional last change in time

signatures.comment: Create an n-dimensional Pt with either default value or random values.

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.comment: number of dimensions

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.comment: optional default value to fill the dimensions

parameters.name: randomize
parameters.comment: if `true`, randomize the value between 0 to default value

properties.name: BYTES_PER_ELEMENT
properties.comment: The size in bytes of each element in the array.

properties.name: buffer
properties.comment: The ArrayBuffer instance referenced by the array.

properties.name: byteLength
properties.comment: The length in bytes of the array.

properties.name: byteOffset
properties.comment: The offset in bytes of the array.
